pros: You learn a lot very quickly. You have freedom to choose your modality of treatment. You have precious clients. Staff is pretty easy going. They will pray for really good training
cons: The pay and benefits are not good

pros: Great peers, flexible hours, access to overtime and great clinical supervisors. Great pay, especially for people that are newer in the field.
cons: Long hours, crisis work can be overwhelming, intense and dangerous. You are dealing with people at their worst, but most people want help. Vaccinations now required upon hire and boosters too.

pros: Flexibility, PTO days, longevity, flexibility
cons: Little ability to grow in the company

pros: Numerous quality employees on staff
cons: Management lack of experience and lack of transparency

review_title: cows at a stock barn is treated better.
pros: PTO, 401k is good. holidays, and wellness day.
cons:
any time requested off, YOU are the employee are to find your cover for every shift, not supervisors. EXTREMELY high school clicky, you well see the favs of supervisors sleeping on the job, or on the phone/computer doing nothing all day, and push work off on others.

YOU will be PUNCHED, KICKED, BITTEN, SCREAMED AT, and be told they need to stay as they are insurance paid/private pay. as at the end of day money talks. but the ones who really need the program will be removed, as they cost the program money to keep.

back in 2000 this place saved people, but now it is all about the numbers, used to only get 1 to 2 intakes a day, so you were able to take care of every client. not it's like cows at a sale, they will bring in 12 to 15 a day, and just want you to take info on them, slap them with tags, and sign papers so the company gets paid, and move them on. I used to be able to remember every one of my clients' names, and life stories to help them, now they are just a number as so many are pushed in, and out of the program to get that money.

pros:
I like working with Volunteer Behavioral Health because:
- caring supervisors
- ability to get supervision hours for licensure
- wide range of clients to be able to work with vast experience
-great benefits and training opportunities
cons: Desire for more outside of work engagement.

pros: Helping others in our community
cons: No overtime is highly encouraged.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Chattanooga, TN
pros: benefits were available, boss was very nice
cons: hired on 3rd shift, promised to move shifts as soon as possible. then got told I couldn't move shift due to vacancies, but someone had just left 2nd shift.

job_title: School Social Worker in Cookeville, TN
pros: School calendar, work closely with kids, provide services to kids that might not otherwise get services
cons: Working around daily student academic schedule, spread out from cohort

pros: telehealth is a great service for folks
cons: lack of communication is sometimes an issue

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Chattanooga, TN
pros:
Working with the clients
Clean environment 
Good coworkers
Company’s mission
cons:
Corporate attitude
Lack of communication with supervisor

review_title: Good but hard work, wish it could have been better
pros: Even though it was difficult at times, I liked working for the lower income bracket of mental health patients.
cons: Often the company seemed to only care about the numbers, sometimes due to state regulations but the further up you got the less they seemed in touch with the patients they were helping. Small pay for work put in and rigid workloads. You better hope you get good coworkers or the work will be miserable no matter how much you care about the patients.

pros: Pay increases, it's flexible, great co-workers, doing work that changes lives for the better, and a amazing new CEO.
cons: none to speak of currently

pros: CEO really wants to make a difference.
cons: Communication of policy can be better

pros: Good co-workers and encouraging team work now and better planning for new employee training. More recent opportunities for advancement. Pay rate increases in many positions over the past year.
cons: Communication always lacks something in such a large company but is getting better with new structure in last couple years

pros: The people are nice. It’s a great group of people.
cons: The pay is awful and not worth it.

pros: Supportive management, professional growth opportunities, amazing opportunities to help clients, opportunities to provide community awareness of recovery
cons: Above average for non-profit environments

pros: Good team feeling, everyone friendly to work alongside. Good structure, love the client / staff ratio.
cons: Pay is not as good as could be found working the average LPN position. Orientation is not good.

pros: Connections with fellow employees. Decent benefits.
cons: Too much emphasis on quantity of clients rather than quality with clients. Poor choice with director that led to morale decrease and people leaving.

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Cookeville, TN
pros: supportive team and diverse patient population
cons: High turnover for therapist staff from what I understand

review_title: Fulfilling but MAJOR micromanaging and poor management
pros: Helping people that really need a hand up
cons: Cliquish staff, CM now treated like a call center with no real benefit, you can only advance if you are part of the right group and not based on merit. Micromanagement is alive and well no matter where you work in this company.

review_title: Most case managers quit in under a year at VBHCS
pros:
They hire any warm body
Good for beginner’s experience if you can put up with the job
Depending on which office you are at, you can get fun Clients
cons:
Lowest paying case management job
No chance for a raise or promotion (unless you wait 10 years you might get to be team lead. Good luck with that)
Micromanagement
Unrealistic goals that result in getting written up if they are not reached
Depending on which office you are at, you can get really creepy Clients

pros: The pros are if you are hard working management will work with on your schedule when you need time off for appointments.
cons: The cons are low pay, no advancement opportunities, the people who work hard don't even get a pat on the back while people who sit around and don't pull their weight don't get in trouble.  Management is likes to keep things from employees and it's not even about important things.

pros: Staff is wonderful and cares for each other. They are what make coming to work enjoyable and have each other's backs.
cons: Low salary, rigorous productivity quota, minimal guidance/supervision, minimal opportunity for personal growth and education, corporate does not seem interested in human capital

pros: Experience.  Health insurance for individuals is affordable.
cons: Workplace inside and out is filthy.  Chronically understaffed.  Slacker coworkers with no consequences.  Salary is not competitive.  No pay for overtime.  Management is unavailable and unapproachable.  Unrealistic expectations for minimal staff.  Talent and skill on behalf of employees are not valued or rewarded.  Zero teambuilding.  No opportunity for advancement unless you are favored by "good ole boy" senior management.

pros: Making a positive difference in people's lives. Helping people find resources and medication management. Also, working with good co-workers with the same goals.
cons: Disorganized system, too many time-consuming non-nursing duties, management, and low pay

pros: We are grant based which apparently pays better than actual VBH salary.
cons: Since we are grant based, we barely have any communication from VBH and do not feel a part of the company. Poor pay (cannot imagine what direct employees of VBH receive).

pros: Making a difference in people's lives.
cons: Industry changes...more paper work and pay decrease..

job_title: Mobile Crisis Counselor in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Caring staff and management employers
cons: It's nonprofit, so the pay is not as much as at other health care facilities

job_title: Detox Licensed Practical Nurse in Cookeville, TN
pros: Great pay and great nurses
cons: PRN and part time to start until full time opens

pros: People you work with are great
cons: the starting salary is very low
